org.iiitb.model.bean
Class Memory

java.lang.Object
  org.iiitb.model.bean.Memory

public class Memory
extends java.lang.Object

Simulation of memory management in contiguous, paging and segmentation schemes all require an abstraction of the main memory.

This class models the above mentioned abstraction. It can be logically seen as being composed of several memory units(MemoryUnit).

The main memory model is internally implemented as an ordered symbol table of these MemoryUnit's.

Field Detail

size

protected long size
Size of memory model.

Constructor Detail

Memory

public Memory(long size)
Creates a memory model of the specified size. The entire memory now consists of a single unallocated memory unit(MemoryUnit).

Parameters:
size - The specified size of the memory model.
Method Detail

insert

public void insert(MemoryUnit mu)
            throws InvalidMemoryUnitAllocationRequestException
Insert a memory unit into the memory model.

Parameters:
mu - The memory unit to be inserted
Throws:
InvalidMemoryUnitAllocationRequestException - The specified MemoryUnit is invalid. One of the following things could be the cause
1. No holes(free chunks) at required address
2. The hole at the required address is not big enough

remove

public void remove(long startAddress)
            throws InvalidMemoryUnitAddressException
Deallocates the memory unit associated with a start address and collates it with neighbouring unallocated memory units.

Parameters:
startAddress - The start address of the memory unit that is to be deallocated
Throws:
InvalidMemoryUnitAddressException - The given start address does not specify the start of a memory unit.

unallocate

public void unallocate(long startAddress)
Marks an associated MemoryUnit as free without collating it with neighbouring free memory units.

Parameters:
startAddress - The address of the memory unit that is to be marked as unallocated

get

public MemoryUnit get(long startAddress)
Retrieves the memory unit associated with a start address.

Parameters:
startAddress - The start address of the required memory unit.
Returns:
The associated memory unit object or null if there is no memory unit associated with the specified start address.

getAll

public java.lang.Iterable<MemoryUnit> getAll(long startAddress,
                                             long endAddress)
Returns an iterator over the list of all memory units within the specified address range of this memory model. The memory units are ordered by their start addresses.

Parameters:
startAddress - The start address of the range.
endAddress - The end address of the range
Returns:
An iterable list of memory units of this memory model within the specified address range.

getAll

public java.lang.Iterable<MemoryUnit> getAll()
Returns an iterator over the list of all memory units of this memory model. The memory units are ordered by their start addresses.

Returns:
An iterable list of memory units of this memory model.
